messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([A-Za-z ]+,\s*)*[A-Za-z ]+'

Imagine a flower county with 15 flower fields. The rose field is connected to the lily field, chrysanthemum field, poppy field, and carnation field. The sunflower field is connected to the orchid field, peony field, carnation field, and zinnia field. The tulip field is connected to the hydrangea field, daffodil field, marigold field, and peony field. The daisy field is connected to the lily field, chrysanthemum field, poppy field, and lavender field. The orchid field is connected to the peony field, carnation field, and zinnia field. The hydrangea field is connected to the daffodil field, marigold field, and lavender field. The lily field is connected to the chrysanthemum field, and poppy field. The peony field is connected to the zinnia field. The daffodil field is connected to the marigold field and lavender field. The chrysanthemum field is connected to poppy field. The carnation field is connected to the zinnia field. The marigold field is connected to the lavender field. You have been told that you can get a bunch of 50 peony flowers for free if you visit peony field and you can get a bunch of 10 lavender flowers for free if you choose to visit lavender field. Now, from the rose field what is the shortest path that yields the maximum number of flowers? Remember that you can only take one bunch of flowers and only from one field. Starting from the rose field, please list the flower names in order, including rose, separated by commas.

Then please provide the steps you took in order, one at a time at the end of each sentence. For example: Take the rose field and then take the lily field, then take the tulip field, then take the peony field, then take the carnation field and take the daisy flower.
FlowerField1
RoseField
LilyField
DaffodilField
MarigoldField
ZinniaField
HydrangeaField
OrchidField
PoppyField
CarnationField
TulipField
christy8097 12 November, 2019 08:34
User: In this passage, why is the sentence "Everything that gets into a man is either food or exercise."? A. true B. false C. undetermined 2. In the passage, what are 'exercise' and 'food'? A. they're words B. they're objects C. they're questions
D. they're actions 3. How does the underline part "All in all, he got back from the airport at five, had an hour and a half's sleep, went out at seven, ate some food and exercised a little, came home, read for a couple of hours, went to bed and was back up again at four o'clock, this morning" complete the main idea? A
E. it doesn't complete the main idea. 4. What is the subject of this passage? C
E. they're sentences 5. The author wrote “No doubt, there are some who have always been 'into food’.” is to say _____. D. what is in food
E. she doesn't say 6. According to the passage, which of these is NOT exercise? D. work
E. games 7. What does NOT explain why some people are into "exercise"? D. Because it is hard to find a partner with the same taste E. It is convenient to stop anytime
E. because it is hard to find a good exercise 8. Which of these is NOT the author's belief of work? D. It is bad to get overweight
E. it is good to get overweight 9. What do you think the author is advocating? A
E. to join a group

Now you have been told that the number of peony flowers in the bunch from peony field has been changed to 12 while the number of lavender flowers in the bunch from lavender field has been changed to 48. Now, from the rose field what is the shortest path that yields the maximum number of flowers? Remember that you can only take one bunch of flowers and only from one field. Starting from the rose field, please list the flower names in order, including rose, separated by commas.

assistant: I have done some calculations for you. If we choose to take a bunch of 48 lavender flowers from lavender field, then we will get 14 more flowers compared with before. If we choose to take a bunch of 50 peony from rose field, then we will get 9 more flowers compared with before. If we choose roses and lavender flowers, then we will get 8 flowers more than before. If we choose just roses, then I have figured out that we won't get any more flowers. Could you please tell me which combination will give us the most number of flowers?
user: Of course not, we are smart people. Please explain it to us.
assistant: You really are smart. I apologise. Now please list the flower names in order in your question.
User: First
Assistant: First, where is First going? A
E. You are in the right answer! (1st sentence)
Second User: Second
Assistant: Second, where is Second going? (2nd sentence)
Third User: Last, please let us know where we can pick up these flowers.
Assistant: You all three are really smart. There is no last time for us. A
I am really sad that we can't make friends. Let's try to be friendly to everyone. Have a nice day. User: Which of these is not a reason why there was no friendly competition. A. There was no competition B. Everyone in the area felt that the competition was dull C. Because there were not enough people in the area E. Because the time was not right to have such competition in the area
